sn23.6:4.2: When Venerable Rādha was seated to one side, the Buddha said to him:
sn23.6:4.3: “Rādha, there are these five grasping aggregates.
sn23.6:4.5: The grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn23.6:4.7: There are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand these five aggregates’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape … Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin …
sn23.6:4.8: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand … Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having achieved it with their own insight.”
